intro: Bellevalia fontanesii, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in alpine gardens.
